message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Tacrolimus and azathioprine are both medications used to prevent transplant rejection. Tacrolimus can cause kidney injury as a side effect, so the patient should be monitored for this adverse effect. Gingival hyperplasia is a side effect of some immunosuppressive drugs, but not these two. Hepatic necrosis and polycythemia are not common adverse effects of these medications.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Tacrolimus and azathioprine are immunosuppressants used to prevent rejection in renal transplant patients. Both medications have the potential to cause kidney injury, so the patient should be monitored regularly for changes in renal function. Gingival hyperplasia is a side effect of calcium channel blockers, hepatic necrosis is a side effect of acetaminophen overdose, and polycythemia is not a known side effect of these medications.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Tacrolimus and azathioprine are both immunosuppressive drugs used to prevent rejection of the transplanted kidney. However, they can also cause kidney injury as a side effect, so the patient should be monitored for this adverse effect. Gingival hyperplasia is a side effect of several other drugs, including phenytoin and cyclosporine, but not these two medications. Hepatic necrosis is a side effect of acetaminophen and some other drugs, but not these two immunosuppressants. Polycythemia is not a common adverse effect of either medication.
